article.title: Angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy with quantum gas microscopes

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is NOT true about Figure 1?
choices: The proposed setup involves transferring a single particle from a filled 1D system (S) to an adjacent 1D “detection” system (Sdet).
The rate of transferred atoms is proportional to the spectral function A(k, ω).
The figure demonstrates the measurement of the single-magnon spectral function.
The spectral function can be obtained by measuring the final position of the transferred atom and repeating the measurement for various lattice modulation times.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of introducing a potential gradient (Egrad) along the x-direction in Method 1 of Figure 2?
choices: To create a harmonic confinement in the 1D system.
To map momentum space into position space by connecting quasi-momentum states to Wannier-Stark states localized on single lattice sites.
To initiate time-of-flight expansion along the x-direction.
To implement a quarter period rotation in phase-space for momentum detection.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 3 illustrate about the temperature dependence of the spectral function A(k, ω) of a single hole in the t − J∗ model?
choices: The spectral building principle accurately predicts peak positions at all temperatures.
Spin-charge separation is only observed at high temperatures (T ≫ J).

At low temperatures, individual holon and spinon branches in the spectrum are clearly visible, while at high temperatures (T ≫ J), the distribution of spectral weight is dominated by the density of states.
Thermal fluctuations in energy and momentum sharpen the peaks predicted by the spectral building principle.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the shaded area in Figure 4 represent?
choices: The region in k − ω space where no spectral weight exists.
The region in k − ω space where spectral weight exists at zero temperature, determined by the spinon and holon dispersions.
The combined dispersion relation of the spinon and holon at finite temperature.
The momentum distribution of the holon in a finite system.
